zib.gloss: a unit of information equal to 1024 exbibytes or 2^70 bytes

zibit.gloss: a unit of information equal to 1024 exbibits or 2^70 bits

zidovudine.gloss: an antiviral drug (trade name Retrovir) used in the treatment of AIDS

ziegfeld.gloss: United States theatrical producer noted for a series of extravagant revues known as the Ziegfeld Follies (1869-1932)

ziegler.gloss: German chemist honored for his research on polymers (1898-1973)

zig.gloss: an angular shape characterized by sharp turns in alternating directions

zigadene.gloss: any of various plants of the genus Zigadenus having glaucous leaves and terminal racemes of mostly white flowers

zigadenus.gloss: genus of mostly North American poisonous plants

zigadenus elegans.gloss: plant of western North America having grasslike leaves and greenish-white flowers

zigadenus glaucus.gloss: plant of eastern and central North America having creamy white flowers tinged with brown or purple

zigadenus venenosus.gloss: plant of western North America to Mexico

zigadenus venenosus gramineus.gloss: plant of western North America to Mexico

ziggurat.gloss: a rectangular tiered temple or terraced mound erected by the ancient Assyrians and Babylonians

zigzag.gloss: an angular shape characterized by sharp turns in alternating directions
having short sharp turns or angles

zikkurat.gloss: a rectangular tiered temple or terraced mound erected by the ancient Assyrians and Babylonians

zikurat.gloss: a rectangular tiered temple or terraced mound erected by the ancient Assyrians and Babylonians

zillion.gloss: a very large indefinite number (usually hyperbole)

zimbabwe.gloss: a landlocked republic in south central Africa formerly called Rhodesia

zimmer.gloss: a light enclosing framework (trade name Zimmer) with rubber castors or wheels and handles

zimmer frame.gloss: a light enclosing framework (trade name Zimmer) with rubber castors or wheels and handles

zinacef.gloss: a cephalosporin that can be given parenterally (trade name Zinacef) or orally by tablets (trade name Ceftin)

zinc blende.gloss: an ore that is the chief source of zinc

zinc sulfide.gloss: a yellow to white crystalline fluorescent compound that occurs naturally as sphalerite or wurtzite and is used as a luminous pigment

zinc sulphide.gloss: a yellow to white crystalline fluorescent compound that occurs naturally as sphalerite or wurtzite and is used as a luminous pigment

zinc white.gloss: a white pigment used in house paints

zing.gloss: the activeness of an energetic personality

zingiber.gloss: tropical Asiatic and Polynesian perennial plants: ginger

zingiber officinale.gloss: tropical Asian plant widely cultivated for its pungent root

zingiberaceae.gloss: a family of tropical monocotyledonous plants of order Musales

zinjanthropus.gloss: genus to which Australopithecus boisei was formerly assigned

zinnia.gloss: any of various plants of the genus Zinnia cultivated for their variously and brightly colored flower heads

zinnia acerosa.gloss: subshrub with slender woolly stems and long narrow leaves and flower heads with white rays

zinnia grandiflora.gloss: subshrub having short leafy stems and numerous small flower heads with nearly round yellow-orange rays

zinsser.gloss: United States bacteriologist who helped develop immunization against typhus fever (1878-1940)

zion.gloss: originally a stronghold captured by David (the 2nd king of the Israelites)
Jewish republic in southwestern Asia at eastern end of Mediterranean
an imaginary place considered to be perfect or ideal

zionism.gloss: a movement of world Jewry that arose late in the 19th century with the aim of creating a Jewish state in Palestine

zionist movement.gloss: a movement of world Jewry that arose late in the 19th century with the aim of creating a Jewish state in Palestine

zip.gloss: a code of letters and digits added to a postal address to aid in the sorting of mail
a fastener for locking together two toothed edges by means of a sliding tab

zip code.gloss: a code of letters and digits added to a postal address to aid in the sorting of mail

zip fastener.gloss: a fastener for locking together two toothed edges by means of a sliding tab

zipper.gloss: a fastener for locking together two toothed edges by means of a sliding tab

zircon.gloss: a common mineral occurring in small crystals

zirconium.gloss: a lustrous grey strong metallic element resembling titanium

zirconium silicate.gloss: a common mineral occurring in small crystals

zit.gloss: a small inflamed elevation of the skin

zither.gloss: a musical stringed instrument with strings stretched over a flat sounding board

zithern.gloss: a musical stringed instrument with strings stretched over a flat sounding board

zithromax.gloss: a systemic antibacterial medicine (trade name Zithromax) that is prescribed to treat bacterial infections in many different parts of the body

zizania aquatica.gloss: perennial aquatic grass of North America bearing grain used for food

ziziphus.gloss: spiny chiefly tropical American and Asiatic shrubs: jujubes

ziziphus jujuba.gloss: spiny tree having dark red edible fruits

ziziphus lotus.gloss: shrubby deciduous tree of the Mediterranean region

zig-zag.gloss: having short sharp turns or angles
